org.forgerock.openam.cts.api

Class CTSOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.cts.api.CTSOptions

  • public final class CTSOptions
extends Object
    Options are intended to provide guidance to the CTS as to how it should perform the requested operation. Typically this will be passed through to the backing implementation and handled in an implementation specific way.

    Options should be considered optional, in that the backing implementation may not be able to support them and should signal this accordingly.

    Options by their very nature need to be generic in what they represent. For example the OPTIMISTIC_CONCURRENCY_CHECK_OPTION is a concept which is then implemented in the backing implementation in a specific way. Therefore the Option should be generic, with the value it contains, specific.

    Since:
    14.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.forgerock.util.Option<String> OPTIMISTIC_CONCURRENCY_CHECK_OPTION
      Signals the CTS to perform an optimistic concurrency check before making a change to a CTS token.
      static org.forgerock.util.Option<CoreTokenField[]> PRE_DELETE_READ_OPTION
      Signals the CTS to perform a read of a CTS token on delete.

    • Field Detail

      • OPTIMISTIC_CONCURRENCY_CHECK_OPTION

        public static final org.forgerock.util.Option<String> OPTIMISTIC_CONCURRENCY_CHECK_OPTION
        Signals the CTS to perform an optimistic concurrency check before making a change to a CTS token.

        The value of the option will be used to base the concurrency check assertion on.

        Applicable for use with update and delete CTS operations.

        See Also:
        ETagAssertionCTSOptionFunction

      • PRE_DELETE_READ_OPTION

        public static final org.forgerock.util.Option<CoreTokenField[]> PRE_DELETE_READ_OPTION
        Signals the CTS to perform a read of a CTS token on delete.

        The value of the option will be used to determine if the token is read on the delete operation.

        Applicable for use only with the delete CTS operation.

        See Also:
        DeletePreReadOptionFunction
